instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message:
Computer has had previous liquid damage.
does work fine on battery.
green has a dim flash about once a second
PPDCIN_S5_CHGR pulses from 0v to 18v
ppbus_g3_h also pulses from 0 to 18v
have replaced isl, q7085 and q7080
no short to ground on ppdcin_s5_chgr

i don't know where to look on this guy, 
i have been looking over the schematic and i can't seem to find something that will pull the line down every second.
any suggestions?

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message: Sounds like a bad ISL6259. Check all the sense resistors and R7005 too.

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message: I did replaced 6259, ill try to replace it again. For sense resistors, you are referring to the the ones around isl?

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message: R7021/22/51/52 R7005 are the usual suspects. ACOK should at least come high

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message: Thank you, i will check em out tomorrow!

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message:
r7021 10
r7022 9.9
r7051 2.4
r7052 .3
r7005 20.2
 smc_bc_acok is pulsing also

is there anything else i should check before replacing u7000 again?

threads.title: 820-3115-b No power with charger
threads.message:
r7080 was measuring 30k instead of 100k
replaced r7080 and replaced q7080 and got green light. and fan spin. i think im in the clear.
